title: Roman Numerals to Decimal
problem_statement:
Roman Numerals to Decimal

Problem Description

In a book store, the books are arranged using Roman Numeral values. Lata wants to issue some books for which she needs to know the Decimal Numeral values. Write a program to help Lata in issuing books by converting Roman Numerals to Decimal Format. The Roman numerals should be entered as per the stipulated rules.

The mapping of Roman numerals to their decimal values is as follows:

RomanDecimal
I1
V5
X10
L50
C100
D500
M1000

Read the Input from STDIN (standard input) and Print to STDOUT (standard output) with a trailing new line. You should not write arbitrary strings while reading the input and while printing as these contribute to the standard output.

Constraints

  • Input should be a valid Roman Numeral value.

Input Format: The input contains the Roman Numeral value.

Output Format: The output contains the Decimal Numeral value. Print 0 if the Roman number provided as input is invalid.

Examples

Example 1:

Input: XVII
Output: 17

Explanation: XVII, Here, X is 10 and VII is 7. Thus, total is 17.

Example 2:

Input: CXLIX
Output: 149

Explanation: CXLIX, Here, C is 100, XL is 40 and IX is 9. Thus, total is 149.

Starter Code

#include <iostream>
using namespace std;

int romanToDecimal(string roman) {
    int dec = -1;
    // WRITE YOUR CODE HERE
    return dec;
}

int main() {
    string roman;
    cin >> roman;
    cout << romanToDecimal(roman) << endl;
    return 0;
}

title: First Occurring Even Number
problem_statement:
First Occurring Even Number

Problem Description

You are given an array of size N. Write a program to find and print the first occurring even number from the given array. Read the input from STDIN and print the output to STDOUT. Do not write arbitrary strings while reading the input or while printing, as these contribute to the standard output.

Input Format

The first line of input contains a positive number N representing the size of the array. The second input line contains N numbers representing the array elements separated by a single whitespace.

Output Format

The output should display the first occurring even number present in the array.

Examples

Example 1:

Input: 5
11 15 82 22 2
Output: 82

Explanation: The array has 5 integers, and the first even number is 82. Final Result = 82

Constraints

  • 1 <= N <= 10^6
  • Array Elements <= 10^6
  • The array should contain at least one even number.
